intro: Rheum rupestre, commonly known as the rock rhubarb, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its large,戟-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of white, powdery wax. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the summer months. Rheum rupestre is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses in its native regions.
